description: This table contains the basic information about each transplant patient encounter in your system.

columns.name: PAT_ENC_CSN_ID
columns.description: The unique system identifier for the patient encounter. Contact serial number is unique across all patients and all contacts.

columns.name: LINE
columns.description: The line number for the information associated with this record. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this record.

columns.name: PAT_ENC_DATE_REAL
columns.description: This is a numeric representation of the date of this encounter in your system. The integer portion of the number specifies the date of the encounter. The digits after the decimal point indicate multiple visits on one day.

columns.name: CONTACT_DATE
columns.description: The date on which the patient encounter took place.

columns.name: ORGAN_TRANSPLAN_C_NAME
columns.description:
The organ which was transplanted.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


Bone Marrow


Cornea


Heart


Kidney


Liver


Lung


Pancreas

columns.name: ORGAN_SOURCE_C_NAME
columns.description:
The source of where the transplanted organ came from.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


Cadaver


Living related donor


Living non-related donor

columns.name: TRANSPLANT_DT
columns.description: The actual date on which the operation took place.

columns.name: PRIOR_REJECTION_YN
columns.description:
Set to Y  if the patient has had a prior rejection episode.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Yes


No

columns.name: ANTIGEN_MATCH_C_NAME
columns.description:
Antigens encourage an immune response in the body. This column contains information about the patient's antigen match level. 


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


One


Two


Three


Four


Five


Six

columns.name: TRANSPLANT_LOC_C_NAME
columns.description:
This column contains information about the location of the transplanted organ. For example, "bilateral", "center", etc. 


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


Bilateral


Center


Left


Right
